quotes.quote: Style is joyful if you allow yourself to have joy.
Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
Style of the future is the convergence of function and fashion.
Style is a reflection of your attitude and your personality.
A good style must, first of all, be clear. It must not be mean or above the dignity of the subject. It must be appropriate.
Style is something you can use, and you can be like a magpie, just taking what you want.
Style ain't nothing but keeping the same idea from beginning to end. Everybody got it.
Style is the gossamer on which the seeds of truth float through the world.
A good style must have an air of novelty, at the same time concealing its art.
Personal style is not something that is just in the air. It is something you have and that you apply to yourself.
Style means the right word. The rest matters little.
Style is only the frame to hold your thoughts. It is like the sash of a window; if heavy, it will obscure the light.
Style is a way to say who you are without having to speak.
Style comes from knowing who you are and who you want to be in the world; it does not come from wanting to be somebody else, or wanting to be thinner, shorter, taller, prettier.
Style is made up of whatever an author can't avoid doing.
Style is an expression of your individuality. Who you are and what your mood is, is what you wear.
Style is the most ephemeral thing I know. It's not about how effective you are it's about how you are effective.
Style is the instrument you can pick back up when you want to regain some of the confidence you've lost.
Style can change your look, certainly, but it can also change your life.
Style has always been in my mind the author's Self, the creative expression of that Self.
My style of leadership is to lead with the lightest touch that I possibly can.
The essence of style is a simple way of saying something complex.
Style is when they're running you out of town and you make it look like you're leading the parade.
Style is the perfection of a point of view.
Style is primarily a matter of instinct.
Style is the dress of thoughts, and let them be ever so just.
Style is instinctive and few achieve it in a notable degree. Its development is not hastened by instruction. It comes or it doesn't. It will take care of itself.
Style is very different from fashion. Once you find something that works, keep it.
Style is a celebratory expression of your life force. You must approach it with a sense of joie de vivre.
Style is whatever you want to do, if you can do it with confidence.
